poem:
**Mechanical Sky**

A fault in the heavens,
metal and flame interrupted,
as in a dream the stars shudder—
wings of ambition clipped,
silent the whispers of data
unspoken. Earthbound,
we gaze at the mechanics of our loss,
the distance further now,
between what we are 
and what we wish to become.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. The second-stage engine failure occurred on Thursday evening during a routine launch of the satellites from Vandenberg space force base in Santa Barbara county, California. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
